page.title: 16Bradford's First Asian Mayor
page.content: Bradford's new Lord Mayor has had a rather unusual origin compared with his predecessors. Bradford's new Lord Mayor is{Councillor Mohammed Ajeeb,} the son of a humble village farmer of {Pakistan.}Ajeeb is the first Asian to receive this post and sees this as an achievement that is worthy of honour for both the{Asian}and black communities of Bradford. His roots are from a small village in the district of Mirpur in Azad Kashmir. At the age of fifteen, he left home to go to Karachi. Soon, he graduated with a B.A. degree from its University. He then came to Britain and for fourteen years lived in Nottingham working on the buses. Shortly before his term of office began, I asked him how he felt about a recent survey which said that Bradford is one of the worst cities in Britain?
